verses.verse: (Ps. 144:5, 7) He shall send from heaven and save me; He reproaches the one who would swallow me up. Selah God (Ps. 43:3) shall send forth His mercy and His truth.
My soul is among lions; I lie among the sons of men Who are set on fire, (Prov. 30:14) Whose teeth are spears and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.
(Ps. 108:5) Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; Let Your glory be above all the earth.
(Ps. 9:15) They have prepared a net for my steps; My soul is bowed down; They have dug a pit before me; Into the midst of it they themselves have fallen. Selah
(Ps. 108:1-5) My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; I will sing and give praise.
Awake, (Ps. 16:9) my glory! Awake, lute and harp! I will awaken the dawn.
(Ps. 108:3) I will praise You, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing to You among the nations.
(Ps. 103:11) For Your mercy reaches unto the heavens, And Your truth unto the clouds.
(Ps. 57:5) Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; Let Your glory be above all the earth.
The Just Judgment of the Wicked To the Chief Musician. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” A Michtam of David. [1] Do you indeed speak righteousness, you silent ones? Do you judge uprightly, you sons of men?
No, in heart you work wickedness; You weigh out the violence of your hands in the earth.
